intro.p: This nodes deletes files and folders listed in a Path column. The node has got an optional input port for a File System connection which can be used to delete files and folders on different file systems. Note that if the node is connected to a file system all paths will be resolved against the connected file system. In case the input column contains a path from a connected file system and no filesystem connection is connected, the node will fail during execution.

fullDescription.option: The Path column that contains the paths which should be deleted.

If this option is checked, the node will fail if one of the files / folders could not be deleted i.e. it could not be accessed. If it is unchecked the output table will contain a column that indicates if a file/folder got successfully deleted or not.

option.name: Fail if file does not exist

fullDescription.option: If this option is checked the node will fail if one of the files / folders does not exist.

ports.inPort: The input table containing a Path column.
ports.outPort: Table containing the list of files/folders that have been deleted. Based on the fail options, there are additional boolean columns which indicates whether a deletion was successful or not and if a file existed or not.
